news.title: Properties on Nagpur's outskirts see huge price appreciation in RR rates
news.para: Ready reckoner rates are a benchmark for paying stamp duty or property tax. Even if a certain property is sold at a lesser price, the duty has to be paid according to the ready reckoner which is the basic minimum rate.

news.title: Visakhapatnam civic body mops up Rs 324 crore in property tax
news.para: The collectible demand for the 2021-22 financial year was 340 crore. On the other hand, the GVMC ended the financial year with 186 crore water tax collection – the highest in the last three years.

news.title: Pune civic body collects Rs 1,836 crore while PCMC earns Rs 633 crore from property tax
news.para: Till March 31, the PMC had collected Rs1,836 crore, while the PCMC had collected property tax of Rs633 crore. Last year, owing to the pandemic, the PMC was able to collect Rs1,664 crore, while the PCMC collected Rs557 crore as property tax.

news.title: Nashik civic body earns Rs 149.37 crore through property tax
news.para: An official said the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) earned Rs 149.37 crore through property tax in the just-concluded financial year, which was the highest property tax collection for the civic body so far in a fiscal.

news.title: Mysuru development body intent on using land lying vacant in layouts
news.para: ​The layouts identified for the new initiative were developed by the erstwhile City Improvement Trust Board (CITB), and subsequently Muda itself. The land in question had originally been acquired to be developed as sites.

news.title: Property tax collection plunges 4% in a year in Coimbatore
news.para: In the 2020-21 financial year, the city corporation had collected 91% of the target amount. In comparison, it could collect just 87.2% of the target amount in the 2021-22 fiscal.

news.title: Expedite construction of Patna metro rail project: Bihar CM tells officials
news.para: Nitish also asked the officials to start construction work of the proposed subway tunnel connection in between the Bihar Museum and the Patna Museum.

news.title: Hyderabad: Town planning department's revenue up 73% in FY22
news.para: Official data shows that the wing issued 17,572 building permissions and realised a revenue of 1,144 crore in 2021-22 while 2020-21’s revenue was only 661 crore from 11,538 building permissions.

news.title: Stamp & register department, Indore civic body, IDA see rise in revenue
news.para: According to DIG stamp and registration Balkrishna More, Indore made a new record by witnessing registration of a total 1.35 lakh properties in 2021-22 that generated a total Rs 1,835 Crore, which is around 22.23% of the state’s target of Rs 8,200 Crore from stamp and registration fee.

news.title: Kanpur: KDA to use government departments' unused lands for residential purpose
news.para: KDA vice-chairman Arvind Singh on Friday convened a meeting with the officials of the labour department and discussed about unused land of its department lying in the city.

news.title: Andhra Pradesh registration department fetches Rs 7,327 crore in revenues
news.para: The government pocketed Rs 7,327 crore which translates into 35% growth rate over the last fiscal. The department fetched nearly Rs 1,000 crore revenue in the month of March, which is considered to be highest for a month.

news.title: Indore civic body allot PMAY flats to 413 families under relocation policy
news.para: According to IMC superintendent engineer Mahesh Sharma, the civic has started developing RE-2 Road that will have 24-meter in width and 4,250 meter in length by spending around Rs 42 Crore on the construction.

news.title: Hubballi: Developers raise property prices as raw material costs go up by 45%
news.para: The unexpected rise in raw material prices has forced real estate developers to raise property prices, and buyers will now have to pay between 2 lakh and 10 lakh more for houses and residential apartments.

news.title: Properties of 214 tax defaulters in Navi Mumbai sealed
news.para: The amount outstanding from these defaulters is around Rs 163 crore, officials said. Some tax defaulters paid their dues between March 15 and 31 when an amnesty scheme was offered by the NMMC officials.

news.title: About 10-15% hike in property price inevitable as input costs rise: Credai Hyderabad
news.para: Just as things were getting back to normal, the Russia-Ukraine conflict reared its head, severely impacting global supply chains, hitting raw material supplies and leading to rising costs, he said.
